member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.AddCSTCResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds to or modifies the tags of the given resource. Tags are metadata that can be used to manage a resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which you want to add or update tags.
The tags you want to modify or add to the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.AddCSTCResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.AddCSTCResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.AddCSTCResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionCmdlet
member.summary: Returns the connection ARN and details such as status, owner, and provider type.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connection'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the connections associated with your account.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: Filters the list of connections to those associated with a specified provider, such as Bitbucket.
The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.
The token that was returned from the previous ListConnections call, which can be used to return the next set of connections in the list.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connections'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ProviderTypeFilter parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ProviderTypeFilter' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCConnectionListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCResourceTagListCmdlet
member.summary: Gets the set of key-value pairs (metadata) that are used to manage the resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource for which you want to get information about tags, if any.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCResourceTagListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.GetCSTCResourceTagListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.NewCSTCConnectionCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a connection that can then be given to other AWS services like CodePipeline so that it can access third-party code repositories. The connection is in pending status until the third-party connection handshake is completed from the console.

para.para: The name of the connection to be created. The name must be unique in the calling AWS account.
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. Currently, the valid provider type is Bitbucket.
The key-value pair to use when tagging the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.NewCSTCConnectionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ConnectionArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.NewCSTCConnectionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.NewCSTCConnectionCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCConnectionCmdlet
member.summary: The connection to be deleted.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connection to be deleted.

note.para: The ARN is never reused if the connection is deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCConnectionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCConnectionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCConnectionCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Removes tags from an AWS resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove tags from.
The list of keys for the tags to be removed from the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.CSTC.RemoveCSTCResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
